content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic pancreatic neuroendocrine carcinoma with liver and bone metastases

Management:	2023 Oct - Commenced Capecitabine-Temozolomide
		2024 Jan - Started Lanreotide 120mg q28 days
		2024 Mar - Palliative radiotherapy to T8 vertebra

Histology:	Poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinoma, Ki67 25%, DAXX/ATRX loss on molecular testing

Current Situation:	Disease progression on current therapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today to discuss recent imaging findings. Unfortunately, his CT scan from 15th April 2024 shows clear evidence of disease progression with growth of multiple liver metastases, the largest increasing from 4.2cm to 6.8cm in segment 7. There are also new bone metastases in the right iliac bone. His chromogranin A has increased significantly from 850 to 2400 over the past 8 weeks.

He reports worsening right upper quadrant pain requiring increased opiate analgesia, with his oxycodone now at 40mg BD. His appetite has deteriorated with early satiety and he has lost 4kg over the past month. His performance status has declined to ECOG 2. On examination, there is tender hepatomegaly extending 6cm below the costal margin.

Given the clear evidence of disease progression and declining performance status, we have discussed changing treatment strategy. I have explained that the standard second-line option would be FOLFOX chemotherapy. We reviewed the potential benefits and risks in detail, including neutropenia, neuropathy, and impact on quality of life. [redacted name] understands that this is palliative treatment with the aims of controlling disease progression and improving symptoms.

We will proceed with FOLFOX chemotherapy, starting next week. I have arranged insertion of a PICC line for Thursday. We will continue Lanreotide for symptom control. I have increased his oxycodone to 50mg BD and added metoclopramide for nausea. He will be reviewed by our palliative care team for additional symptom management support.

The plan is to assess response after 3 cycles with CT imaging and chromogranin A measurement. We will see him weekly during the first cycle to monitor tolerability. I have also referred him to our dietitian for nutritional support.
